author: Kenan Machado
title: Asia-Pacific Stocks Rise on Receding Anxiety About Global Trade
text:
Dow industrials extend rally European, Asia-Pacific indexes rebound Investors eye trade talks, European M&A The Dow Jones Industrial Average edged up Tuesday, extending sharp gains from the previous session, as fears of a trade war between the U.S. and China continued to fade.
The Dow rose 85 points, or 0.4%, to 24287, while the S&P 500 added 0.1% and the tech-focused Nasdaq Composite declined 0.2%.
Shares...
